creditline: Lent by The Wang Xing Lou Collection
description: blue and white covered-bowl-shaped vase; tapered foot, bowl shaped body, concave shaped neck, mouth tapered in with bead rim, band of early bronze style design on body and lower part of neck; has own storage box
text: The principal decoration here consists of two wide bands of archaistic dragons, one around the body and the other around the shoulder. Each is composed of two pairs of stylized dragons with elaborately foliated angular tails. The austere decoration is derived from ancient ritual bronzes, where such confronted profile dragons were often found in border patterns. The overt use of ancient bronze motifs makes this vase appropriate for an ancestral altar table or a palace library.
title: Vase with Archaistic Dragon Design
